See also: bauch

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German būch, from Old High German būh, from Proto-Germanic *būkaz (“belly, body”). More at bouk.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /baʊ̯x/, [baʊ̯x], [baʊ̯χ]
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Bauch m (genitive Bauches or Bauchs, plural Bäuche)

  1. abdomen, belly

Declension[edit]

Declension of Bauch
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinderBauchdieBäuche
genitiveeinesdesBauches,
Bauchs		derBäuche
dativeeinemdemBauch,
Bauche1		denBäuchen
accusativeeinendenBauchdieBäuche
1Now uncommon, see notes

Derived terms[edit]

  • bauchig
  • Schmerbauch, Schmeerbauch

See also[edit]

  • Magen

Proper noun[edit]

Bauch m or f (genitive Bauchs)

  1. A surname​.

Further reading[edit]

  • Bauch in Duden online

Luxembourgish[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German būch, from Old High German būh, from Proto-Germanic *būkaz (“belly, body”). More at bouk.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /bæu̯χ/, [bæˑʊ̯χ]

Noun[edit]

Bauch m (plural Bäich)

  1. stomach, belly
